result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Quintin R Scott

records.addlTxt: Hearing on January 9, 2023 at 02:00 pm.

NEW CONDITIONS ORDERED ON 10/31/22: Defendant is not to have any violent contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney. 

PREVIOUSLY ISSUED CONDITIONS: Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with Victim B and Witness A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.    Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.

3:20 PM Defendant Quintin R Scott in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Quintin R Scott.  Prosecuting attorney Lindsey Hirt in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Hughes requests that the no contact for Victim A gets modified to remove that condition or modify it to no violent contact.  Atty Hirt notes that Victim A is not present today; she does not know the Victim's position. The State will leave it to the Court's discretion. Atty Hughes confirms he discussed this with Victim A who is in agreement with their request. For reasons placed on the record, the Court will grant the motion to modify bail.  Court will order conditions be modified as follows: Defendant to have no violent contact with Victim A, all other conditions will remain as previously set. Court inquires as to the status of the case. Atty Hughes advises his client is in counseling and is requesting a further proceedings date in about 60 days. Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 02:00 pm.
Bail/bond hearing on October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

1:45 PM; Case called for Hearing. Defendant Quintin R Scott in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Quintin R Scott.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Hughes provides an update; his client has been able to get into and started DV classes.  Atty. Hughes advises he just filed a motion to modify bond and is request a hearing be set on that motion.  Atty. Hughes is requesting that hearing on his motion to modify bail be set as soon as possible.  Court will adjourn for bail bond hearing.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Filed by Atty. Hughes.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:13 PM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Quintin R Scott in court.  Attorney Steven Hughes in court for Quintin R Scott.  Court reviews the case on the record and inquires as to the status.  Atty. Hughes provides an update, his client has just begun treatment.  Atty. Hughes requests a further proceedings in about 60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

09:01 AM Defendant Quintin R Scott in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Patrick Ryan Campbell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney Hughes states the offer contemplates up front treatment and requests to adjourn for the Defendant to complete the treatment.
The State has no objection.
The Court will adjourn.  Hearing scheduled for August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

09:00 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Quintin R Scott in court with attorney Steven Hughes.  Chelsea Thompson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Hughes provides an update and believes the matter is on its way to being resolved.  Atty. Hughes is requesting one more further proceedings in about 45 days.  Court adjourns for futher proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 09:00 am.

10:36 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Quintin R Scott in court with attorney Steven Hughes.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern Alyssa Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Hughes provides the court with a corrected address for his client.  Atty. Hughes advises he has discovery but is waiting on an offer.  Alyssa Jay will make sure the ADA assigned to the case will send defense an offer.  Atty. Hughes requests a further proceedings date in about 30 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Quintin R Scott
Current: 2115 Norhardt Drive Apt 6B, Brookfield, WI 53045   (Effective: 04-15-2022)
Prior: 2115 Norhardt Drive Apt 6A, Brookfield, WI 53045

addressed to: Quintin R Scott for hearing on 04-15-22

02:00 PM Defendant Quintin R Scott in court, in custody, with attorney Ricardo Tapia.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for April 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
